noun.description: Something, especially a structure, established to remind people of a person or event.
examples: a monument built as a memorial to those who fell in the Civil War

noun.description: A statement of facts, especially as the basis of a petition.
examples: the council sent a strongly worded memorial to the chancellor

origin: Late Middle English: from late Latin memoriale record, memory, monument, from Latin memorialis serving as a reminder, from memoria memory.
